key_insight: AnyAD presents a single unified anomaly-detection model that works with any subset of multi-sequence brain MRI â€” it handles missing modalities at inference without retraining while maintaining robust anomaly detection.
problem_solved: Overcomes clinical challenges of scarce annotated abnormalities and frequently absent MRI sequences by avoiding fixed-modality pipelines and eliminating the need to train separate models for every modality combination.
method: Learn modality-agnostic representations and a shared anomaly scoring mechanism so the same model can ingest any available subset of MRI sequences.
Train with simulated missing-modality conditions (e.g., modality dropout / cross-modal consistency) and reconstruction/consistency objectives to enable prediction from incomplete inputs.
Unified inference: compute anomaly scores/maps directly from whatever sequences are present, without modality-specific retraining or ensemble models.
impact: Makes anomaly detection in multi-sequence MRI practical for real clinical settings with variable imaging protocols, improving deployability and reducing annotation/training burden for AI practitioners working on medical imaging.
visual_elements: Architecture diagram: modality-agnostic encoder + fusion + anomaly scorer, showing that any subset of sequences can be input.
Modality-availability grid (heatmap) illustrating training/inference across all possible sequence combinations and robustness to missing scans.
Performance chart (ROC/AUPRC or bar plot) comparing AnyAD vs. fixed-modality baselines under increasing modality dropout rates.
Clinical pipeline sketch: heterogeneous MRI inputs (some missing) -> AnyAD -> anomaly heatmap and score for triage
paper_title: AnyAD: Unified Any-Modality Anomaly Detection in Incomplete Multi-Sequence MRI
paper_authors: Changwei Wu, Yifei Chen, Yuxin Du, Mingxuan Liu, Jinying Zong
